org.pentaho.pat.rpc
Interface Session

All Superinterfaces:
com.google.gwt.user.client.rpc.RemoteService
All Known Implementing Classes:
SessionServlet
public interface Session
extends com.google.gwt.user.client.rpc.RemoteService

The session RPC interface is responsible for screen operations. It exposes calls to establish connections, start sessions and so forth.

Author:
Luc Boudreau

Method Detail

createSession

@Secured(value="ROLE_USER")
java.lang.String createSession()
                               throws RpcException
Creates a new session. Call this method for every browser window that gets opened. It will return to you a unique identification string which you will need to provide for all future calls.

Returns:
A unique session identification string.
Throws:
RpcException - If something goes sour.

closeSession

@Secured(value="ROLE_USER")
void closeSession(java.lang.String sessionId)
                  throws RpcException
Destroys the session on the server. Call this method when the browser window is closed.

Parameters:
sessionId - The session id to close and destroy.
Throws:
RpcException - If something goes sour.

connect

@Secured(value="ROLE_USER")
void connect(java.lang.String sessionId,
                     CubeConnection connection)
             throws RpcException
Establishes a connection using the provided CubeConnection object.

Parameters:
sessionId - The window session id.
connection - The connection parameters.
Throws:
RpcException - If something goes sour.

disconnect

@Secured(value="ROLE_USER")
void disconnect(java.lang.String sessionId)
                throws RpcException
Closes the current connection.

Parameters:
sessionId - The window session id.
Throws:
RpcException - If something goes sour.

getConnection

@Secured(value="ROLE_USER")
CubeConnection getConnection(java.lang.String sessionId,
                                     java.lang.String connectionName)
                             throws RpcException
Loads a saved connection object for the database. The connection will not be established. It is only returned to the GUI.

Parameters:
sessionId - The window session id.
connectionName - The name of the connection to load.
Returns:
The connection object corresponding to the name passed as a parameter. Null if no connection of that name exist.
Throws:
RpcException - If something goes sour.

saveConnection

@Secured(value="ROLE_USER")
void saveConnection(java.lang.String sessionId,
                            CubeConnection connection)
                    throws RpcException
Saves a connection parameters for later use.

Parameters:
sessionId - The window session id.
connection - The connection object to save.
Throws:
RpcException - If something goes sour.

getSavedConnections

@Secured(value="ROLE_USER")
CubeConnection[] getSavedConnections(java.lang.String sessionId)
                                     throws RpcException
Returns all the currently saved connections for a given user.

Parameters:
sessionId - The window session id.
Returns:
An array of connection names.
Throws:
RpcException - If something goes sour.

deleteSavedConnection

void deleteSavedConnection(java.lang.String sessionId,
                           java.lang.String connectionName)
                           throws RpcException
Deletes a saved user connection.

Parameters:
sessionId - The window session id.
connectionName - The name of the connection to delete.
Throws:
RpcException - If anything goes sour.

createNewQuery

@Secured(value="ROLE_USER")
java.lang.String createNewQuery(java.lang.String sessionId)
                                throws RpcException
Tells the server that we want to create a new query. It will create a new query against the currently selected cube. You can set the currently selected cube with Session.setCurrentCube. It returns a unique identification string to identify the query created.

Parameters:
sessionId - The window session id.
Returns:
The unique ame of the created query.
Throws:
RpcException - If something goes sour.

setCurrentQuery

@Secured(value="ROLE_USER")
void setCurrentQuery(java.lang.String sessionId,
                             java.lang.String queryId)
                     throws RpcException
Tells the backend that from now on, operations will be performed on the specified query.

Parameters:
sessionId - The window session id.
queryId - The name of the query we'll be performing operations from now on.
Throws:
RpcException - If something goes sour.

getCurrentQuery

@Secured(value="ROLE_USER")
java.lang.String getCurrentQuery(java.lang.String sessionId)
                                 throws RpcException
Tells which is the currently selected query.

Parameters:
sessionId - The window session id.
Returns:
The unique id of the currently selected query.
Throws:
RpcException - If something goes sour.

java.lang.String[] getQueries(java.lang.String sessionId)
                              throws RpcException
Returns the list of currently created queries.

Parameters:
sessionId - The window session id.
Returns:
An array of query unique names.
Throws:
RpcException - If something goes sour.

deleteQuery

@Secured(value="ROLE_USER")
void deleteQuery(java.lang.String sessionId,
                         java.lang.String queryId)
                 throws RpcException
Closes and releases a given query.

Parameters:
sessionId - The window session id.
queryId - The query we want to close and release.
Throws:
RpcException

getCurrentCube

@Secured(value="ROLE_USER")
java.lang.String getCurrentCube(java.lang.String sessionId)
                                throws RpcException
Returns which cube the server is currently using for discovery and query operations.

Parameters:
sessionId - The window session id.
Returns:
The name of the currently selected cube.
Throws:
RpcException - If something goes sour.

setCurrentCube

@Secured(value="ROLE_USER")
void setCurrentCube(java.lang.String sessionId,
                            java.lang.String cubeId)
                    throws RpcException
Tells the server which is the current cube we want to work with. All the following operations will assume that we are using this cube. To obtain a list of available cubes, refer to the Discovery RPC interface.

Parameters:
sessionId - The window session id.
cubeId - The cubeId we want to work with.
Throws:
RpcException - If something goes sour.
